question.text: What is correct about the test-tube baby program?

options.text: The fertilisation of ovum with sperms occurs outside the female body, in the laboratory.
The resultant zygote upto 8-blastomere stage is transferred to test tube for further development into baby.
In vitro fertilization is followed by embryo transfer into fallopian tube or uterus of female.

Both <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

solution.text: In the test tube baby program an ovum is collected from the wife/donor (female) and sperms are collected from husband/ donor (male) and are induced to form zygote under simulated conditions in the laboratory.
